story:
Thrillride Mechanics in association with Children's Creativity Museum and Debra Mosk Productions Present

The Show:

WUNDERWORLD tells the story of an 80 year-old Alice going back down the rabbit hole for one last adventure. Much has changed since her first visit, including the cast of colorful characters that populate what is now known as Wunderworld. How will time and age affect Alice and her friends? Is the Rabbit still late? Is the Hatter still mad? Will Alice find her way back to the retirement villa or lose her head in the process? Find out in this musical stage production created and performed by the Thrillride Mechanics: the Bay Area's hyper-comical theater of human animation!

THIS JUST IN: WUNDERWORLD is returning to San Francisco in a big way! Join us July 13-August 11 at the Creativity Theater, the beautiful new theater at the Children's Creativity Museum in Yerba Buena Gardens! Audiences of all ages have already fallen in love with elderly Alice and this innovative retelling of Lewis Carroll's classic tale. Now the show is bigger, bolder, and better than ever! There's much more in store for WUNDERWORLD and we need your help!

By donating to our IndieGoGo campaign you become an integral part of bringing WUNDERWORLD to its new home at the Creativity Theater. We're going BIG, extending the show to its full length and updating the production values in exciting new ways. With a little bit of help from you, we can ensure that Alice and friends look great, sound great, and tell a great story with a lot of heart.

 

What We Need:

Thanks to the generosity of our funders, we have MET our 5K fundraising goal! This means we will be able to pay for all of the things on our wish-list, including:

  • Costume Upgrades (materials, design, construction)
  • Scenic Elements (new steamer trunk, rolling screen)
  • WUNDERWORLD website (domain & web hosting)
  • Updated Sound Design (music, sound effects, speakers)
  • Publicity (PR materials, publicist, advertisements)

But there are still plenty of places where we need your help! We have additional show expenses, such as:

  • Liability Insurance
  • Light/Sound Technician
  • Stage Manager

Plus, we have yet to pay anyone from our fabulously talented creative team! This show has been a true labor of love from the start, and so far our director, writers, and actors have been paid with just that: LOVE! Your additional funds will help us fix that. We'd like to be able to pay good people good money for their time and talents, and for that we need a little help. Our new fundraising goal is $6500 and we're VERY close! Your generous contribution will help the entire WUNDERWORLD community bring you a new and improved show that will surprise and delight!

 

What You Get:

Besides the thrill of bringing new theatre to life, your donation may get you a fun keepsake or two. We've got:

  • Signed WUNDERWORLD souvenir map!
  • Tickets to the Show!
  • Exclusive WUNDER Art! Collect it all!
  • Invitation to an exclusive meatball dinner with the cast!

And now that we've met our goal we have even more ways to show our appreciation to you, our generous benefactors. We promise it will be worth the investment! Every cent counts so please consider contributing whatever you can!

 

The Impact:

In addition to being a fun, hilarious, highly-inventive show, WUNDERWORLD is a poignant and loving exploration of what it means to grow up and grow old. We're all going to get there, if we're lucky, and Alice's further adventures highlight the good and the bad of being elderly. Told in the unique, wordless, clown opera style, it's a universally entertaining tale for everyone from toddlers to great-great grandpas. It needs to be told, it needs to be seen, and YOU can help make it happen!

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

After you've donated you can still help us in other easy, high-impact ways. For instance, you can:

  • Tell everyone you know about the show!
  • Forward this campaign to all your friends, especially those who love theatre and have money!
  • Like us on FaceBook: search for Thrillride Mechanics!

 

If You're Not Convinced:

Or even if you are, check out these great quotes from some of our audience members who came to see the first fun-sized version of WUNDERWORLD:

"WUNDERWORLD is a miracle of originality. We came in as grownups but left as enchanted 7-year-olds. Don't miss it!" - David Weissman, award-winning documentary filmmaker (The Cockettes, We Were Here)

"What a fun, funny, delightful show! You made me chuckle, guffaw and clap my hands. Don't miss it! Thanks to all!!" - Dan Karkoska, SF event producer

"What a magical experience! Thank you to everyone involved in making this Wunderful show." -Laurie Bushman, acclaimed Bay Area comedienne

"As a choreographer and performer I can honestly say I have never seen anything like WUNDERWORLD before. With all of these artist eviction horror stories flying around SF now is the time to support shows and artists like this. It's truly a lightning bolt of genius. Go see it." - Rory Davis, legendary SF choreographer (Trannyshack/Peaches Christ) 

Thank you so much for your time with us here at WUNDERWORLD! Any and all contributions are greatly appreciated!

See you at the Creativity Theater!

Cheers,

Sara Moore, Michael Phillis, & Debra Mosk

THRILLRIDE MECHANICS

Debra Mosk Productions

Go see it." - Rory Davis, legendary SF choreographer (Trannyshack/Peaches Christ)

THRILLRIDE MECHANICS
Debra Mosk Productions

story:
Short Summary

Verismo Opera Theater, a professional opera company based in Chicagoland’s Oak Park, Illinois, is preparing a production of Verdi’s masterpiece “La Traviata” staged in 1915 Oak Park. The sets, costumes and atmospheric elements will all reflect the signature style of world-renowned architect and Oak Park native Frank Lloyd Wright.

The Verismo Opera Theater team has recruited the assistance of Frank Lloyd Wright scholar and image collector Tom Heinz who will assist in creating unique projections featuring his one-of-a-kind collection of more than 35,000 Frank Lloyd Wright images to create the Wright-inspired set using homes in Oak Park. Mr. Heinz will also prepare a free pre-concert lecture on the work of Frank Lloyd Wright.

Verismo Opera Theater needs your support.  A donation of any amount is a reason to sing!  But if you can afford to help us with props ($150) or to hire a professional costume designer ($200), we can achieve our mission of supplying low-budget/high-value classical lively arts to an opera-loving community stretched for disposable income.  Some folks dream of having season tickets to the Lyric or Met.  We can give them a night at the opera without the prohibitive cost.  You can help.

The mission of the Verismo Opera Club is to engage our audiences by producing relevant, truthful, and emotionally direct performances. We strive to share with our colleagues and patrons the moment of recreation by focusing on the essence of the opera – the music and the humanity within the composer’s score. “Verismo” not only applies to a genre of opera, but rather a philosophy of connecting with our public the eternal truths inherent in everyday life. An opera is merely a collection of the most pivotal moments in life written for each character. The journeys that these characters take us on should resonate with us all as we go through our day-to-day existence. We strive to share on the stage what we experience in our own lives – love, loss, joy, hope. We recognize that by ourselves, the music is lifeless. Therefore we need to share with our audiences in order to create art. 

What We Need & What You Get

This fundraising campaign is specifically designed to pay for the production elements: the sets, costumes & other atmospheric elements, which are designed to reflect the signature style of world-renowned architect and Oak Park native Frank Lloyd Wright.

Production costs are not small- our "bare bones" budget for the production adds up to $3000 for the technical elements. (Costumes: $500 Props: $150 Sets: $1000 Lights: $600 Tech staff stipends: $750)

In the best of all possible worlds, our budget will be $7000  (Costumes: $1500 Props: $500 Sets: $2500 Lights: $1500 Stipends $1000)

We need you to help us acheive our highest possible level of production!

We have created the following perks to THANK YOU for your donation:

$5 - Verismo Opera's "La Traviata" Magnet

$25 - Autographed production poster for "La Traviata"

$50 - Verismo Opera Theater T-shirt

$100 - Autographed photobook featuring unique designs and photography 

$250 - Autographed "La Traviata" Score

$500 - Traviata DVD + complimentary tickets

$1000 - Attend a Meet-&-Mingle with the stars + complimentary tickets

$2500 - Private concert in your home + Meet-&-Mingle + complimentary tickets

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute financially, we at VOT can still use your help:

Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign-use the Indiegogo share tools!

And if you have interest in getting involved with the company as a volunteer, email volunteers@verismooperatheater.com We need help in all shapes and sizes!!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Verismo Opera Theater, a professional opera company based in Chicagoland’s Oak Park, Illinois, is preparing a production of Verdi’s masterpiece “La Traviata” staged in 1915 Oak Park. The sets, costumes and atmospheric elements will all reflect the signature style of world-renowned architect and Oak Park native Frank Lloyd Wright. The Verismo Opera Theater team has recruited the assistance of Frank Lloyd Wright scholar and image collector Tom Heinz who will assist in creating unique projections featuring his one-of-a-kind collection of more than 35,000 Frank Lloyd Wright images to create the Wright-inspired set using homes in Oak Park. Mr. Heinz will also prepare a free pre-concert lecture on the work of Frank Lloyd Wright.
Verismo Opera Theater needs your support.  A donation of any amount is a reason to sing!  But if you can afford to help us with props ($150) or to hire a professional costume designer ($200), we can achieve our mission of supplying low-budget/high-value classical lively arts to an opera-loving community stretched for disposable income.  Some folks dream of having season tickets to the Lyric or Met.  We can give them a night at the opera without the prohibitive cost.  You can help.
The mission of the Verismo Opera Club is to engage our audiences by producing relevant, truthful, and emotionally direct performances. We strive to share with our colleagues and patrons the moment of recreation by focusing on the essence of the opera – the music and the humanity within the composer’s score. “Verismo” not only applies to a genre of opera, but rather a philosophy of connecting with our public the eternal truths inherent in everyday life. An opera is merely a collection of the most pivotal moments in life written for each character. The journeys that these characters take us on should resonate with us all as we go through our day-to-day existence. We strive to share on the stage what we experience in our own lives – love, loss, joy, hope. We recognize that by ourselves, the music is lifeless. Therefore we need to share with our audiences in order to create art. 



What We Need & What You Get
This fundraising campaign is specifically designed to pay for the production elements: the sets, costumes & other atmospheric elements, which are designed to reflect the signature style of world-renowned architect and Oak Park native Frank Lloyd Wright.
Production costs are not small- our "bare bones" budget for the production adds up to $3000 for the technical elements. (Costumes: $500 Props: $150 Sets: $1000 Lights: $600 Tech staff stipends: $750)
In the best of all possible worlds, our budget will be $7000  (Costumes: $1500 Props: $500 Sets: $2500 Lights: $1500 Stipends $1000)
We need you to help us acheive our highest possible level of production!
We have created the following perks to THANK YOU for your donation:
$5 - Verismo Opera's "La Traviata" Magnet
$25 - Autographed production poster for "La Traviata"
$50 - Verismo Opera Theater T-shirt
$100 - Autographed photobook featuring unique designs and photography 
$250 - Autographed "La Traviata" Score
$500 - Traviata DVD + complimentary tickets
$1000 - Attend a Meet-&-Mingle with the stars + complimentary tickets
$2500 - Private concert in your home + Meet-&-Mingle + complimentary tickets



Other Ways You Can Help


Even if you can’t contribute financially, we at VOT can still use your help:
Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign-use the Indiegogo share tools!
And if you have interest in getting involved with the company as a volunteer, email volunteers@verismooperatheater.com We need help in all shapes and sizes!!!

story:
Short Summary

Dear Diary, Bye. is a play based on Ellie Brown's 4th grade diary from 1984. It features school yard scrapping, a boy crazy tale, family troubles and sweet misunderstandings of adult concepts. It's a comedic and family friendly piece. Did I mention that the diary is being read by a MAN? Yes, it's true.

  • Ellie Brown is a visual artist and an educator. This piece came about when Ellie's father was visiting and he was reading the diary aloud. After a fit of laughing so hard she was crying, it became clear to Ellie that this needed to be staged.
  • The piece premiered at the SoLow festival in 2013, read by Harry Watermeier and directed by Seth Reichgott. After the test run, it became even more clear that the piece needed to exist on a stage. Thank you Harry!
  • Self-producing a creative project is almost impossible in this fiscal climate. I want the finest quality production I can offer, which means having to pay people! Yes, artists do get paid for their work, so please help pay our dear actor (Arlen Hancock) so he can stay in Philadelphia and work on this play. Please help pay the wonderful director, Seth Reichgott, for his amazing talents as a director. Please help pay Plays and Players theater which is an amazing 100 year old theater that we all adore. There are also tech people, a stage manager, sets, marketing, etc. etc. You love the arts and the arts love you!

Who wouldn't want to hear the inner musings of a boy crazy nine-year old girl, read by a man?

What We Need & What You Get

  • As stated above, the money raised will go straight to paying the actor, crew, theater and marketing expenses for the play. The $7000 requested will JUST cover the costs to self-produce this play.
  • As a donor, you become part of the Diary as a friend, a confidant, a crush, a love, etc. Come see the play for free, get your name in the program, have me send you a page of the diary to admire on your walls, have a PRIVATE reading for you and your friends.....Cool, right?
  • All funds raised will go to the project, whether the goal is met or not. Frankly, any remaining funds will go on my credit card and that is no way to produce theater.

The Impact

Your contribution will allow Dear Diary, Bye. to be staged and keep Ellie Brown out of major debt. Most importantly it shows that you support independent theater/art and believe that actors and creative workers should be paid for their time and effort.

  • As a sponsor, you are telling the world that creative work is important and that the voice of a new female playwright needs to be heard.
  • In my life as a fine art photographer, I ran a successful crowd-source campaign to fund a segment of the BAG project. http://elliebrown.com/home.html
  • This piece is about as grassroots as you can get. State and national funding mostly is given to established theater companies, which makes it difficult for an individual producing a play to find financial support. Your support shows that you believe in independent art and theater!

Other Ways You Can Help

As we all say, even a dollar donation can help. If you can't help......Please spread the word via email, word of mouth or on all of your social media pages.

  • Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you from the bottom of my very excited heart!

story:
“There wasn’t a cough or creak in the house...”

A few months ago, Pook's Hill director Ken Schatz began working with a group of professional actors on a rarely-performed one-act play. The casting was just right, and as they began to explore the piece, amazing things started to happen. The characters roared to life in a manner that shook a room of seasoned theatre professionals. The small midtown studio where they had met became a cotton plantation, heavy with menace. Actors exploring new roles transformed into living, breathing, human beings at the end of their ropes, striving for happiness in the confines of the American South. Then came a stunning, goose-bump image at the very end – for a magic moment, everybody held their breath...

The actors relaxed, shook out their arms and legs a bit, and grinned at each other through teary eyes. They knew that this was more than just studio work. They had just been socked in  the gut by one of the greatest, fiercest dramatists in the history of the English language, Tennessee Williams.

Now, Pook's Hill is bringing that extraodinary work to audiences in Something Wild..., three one-act plays by Tennessee Williams.

We hope you'll help us meet our budget. Good theatre costs money, especially here in New York City. With your help, we can bring these rarely seen plays and the unusually daring work of these actors to you.

Pook's Hill

Artistic Director Ken Schatz has had a dedicated and enthusiastic following by New York actors for over 18 years. He is also a prominent figure in the national folk music community, performing and leading singing groups in New York and across the country. Pook's Hill is a new company of theatre artists and musicians led by Ken, producing classic plays and developing innovative performance works from history, literature, and folklore.

Something Wild... is the inaugural production of Pook's Hill. Help us explode into the New York theatre community with this amazing piece of work!

Why We Need Your Help

None of the actors or production staff are getting a salary for this show. They're here because they're passionate about the project. But even with that generosity, our expenses are a burden. You can help us to pay for

  • Theatre rental
  • A beautiful set and lighting design
  • Costumes that help create the world of the play
  • Rehearsal space
  • Insurance (gotta have it!)
  • A ton of other expenses that keep the wheels turning toward opening night!

"Something disturbing something irregular, something brave and honest…”

In his 1948 essay for The New York Star titled Something Wild…, Williams wrote that a performance of a play should “deliver a punch to the solar plexus,” in a kind of “benevolent anarchy.”  He remembered with great admiration a low-budget company of actors who delivered an evening of theater after which “nobody left without a disturbing kink in their nerves or guts.” 

That's the kind of work your contribution makes possible. In the hypercompetive world of entertainment, the thoughtful and the expressive tends to be pushed aside to make room for the flashy and the alluring.  This is your chance to help foster the elements of theater that connect us all in a deep and important way.

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope you can contribute, but times are tough. Here are some other ways you can help:

  • Spread the word! Share this link on Facebook! Tweet it! Shout it from the rooftops!
  • Think of the people in your world that are "connectors" - those folks that know everyone, are involved in everything and make things blossom. (Who knows, maybe that's you!) Get the word out, and ask those folks to help you spread the word to their networks.

  • Volunteer your time. There's much work to be done, building sets, running the house during shows, marketing, etc. We can't have too much help! Let us know if you'd like to pitch in some time by emailing jackmhaley@gmail.com

Thank you!

We're very appreciative of your support and generosity. A family of dedicated and passionate people has grown up around this work, and by helping out, you're a part of that family. We can't thank you enough!

story:
Mission

A painter’s tools are his canvas, his paints, and his brushes.  A choreographer’s tools are her body, the bodies of her collaborators, and space. Both take in the world around him or her and respond; they express it, in all its beauty and monstrosity.  Art is the reply, a path across impossible gaps between people and places.  The Dancescapes Project is one bridge of many.

The mission of the Dancescapes Project is to develop and foster a sustainable modern dance and performance art community in the Tacoma area. Dancescapes seeks to activate marginal spaces through an exploration of dance movement, space, and alternative or imaginary landscapes. To accomplish this, Dancescapes will be a source of modern dance classes for dance enthusiasts of all levels.  It will  produce public performances and offer support for the production of site-specific works and guest teachers.

Right now, we are working to obtain enough funds to pay our teachers for the 8x8 Weekend Dance Workshop in Tacoma, WA.  We've worked so hard to make this event possible and everything has come together.  Thanks to Barefoot Collective we have flooring, lighting, and sound.  Thanks to Spaceworks Tacoma we have a space in which to hold classes and our informal showing.  Help us compensate the teachers and emerging professionals by donating!  Our goal is small and we have only three weeks to raise enough money.  

The Dancescapes Project is not for profit.  All donations go straight to the artists!

story:
Hey there! Alexis Lambright here. Being an adult virgin can be pretty tough. How did I decide to deal with the stress? I wrote a comedy show about it! I've been perfoming this one-woman show, chronicling my actual life as a 20-something, suffering with Chronic Virginity (aka CV). If you like storytelling shows, comedians who are able to poke fun at themselves, or even just watching telethons, you're sure to enjoy this show. Here's a brief description:

Alexis is on a mission to find a 'curer' for people suffering with Chronic Virginity... starting with herself! Through stories, songs, and videos, this tell-a-thon/live telethon will present awkward moments in her life, in hopes of achieving her goal. Operators are standing by!

Performing on the thinnest of shoestring budgets, I've done this show on and off for about two years, at the Magnet Theater in NYC. Now it's going to the New York International Fringe Festival! Well, not quite yet. I still need to pay the registration fee. That's where you come in! With your contribution, you'll help make one of my dreams into a reality.

Last year, I missed the deadline to apply to NY Fringe, because sadly I couldn't even afford the aplication fee. I was extremely broke and struggling to find work. So you'd better believe I'm serious about getting to this festival! I need to raise $650, which will cover the entire registration fee. It's due very soon: May 15th to be exact. I must have it in by the 15th in order to participate. Any amount will be welcomed and appreciated! If you can't contribute, spead the word! Tell your friends, family, enemies, and pets about this campaign.  Thanks in advance!!

story:
(music by: vincent knobil)

The Summoning of Everyman - Komedien om Enhver

(Se Dansk tekst nedenfor)

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/komedienomenhver


At the end of February 2013, the students at Theatre School Holberg, Copenhagen, suddenly lost all their teachers. The board of the school fired our artistic directors and hired a new school leader, who fired the rest of our teachers. He thought that was smart – we thought it was ridiculous, that in only a couple of days, we went from stopping our beloved Shakespeare rehearsals to returning to an arrogant and hostile atmosphere at the school. We didn’t sign up for that. We didn’t pay for that. And we protested. So they just closed our school, leaving us behind with nothing, and then opened it up again, with the same name. And they seem to think that they have no obligations towards us. (No worries though, we have pressed charges)



But we couldn’t stay stuck in those people's political scheme and had to move on and make some theatre. And the decision was to put on the play “The Summoning of Everyman” by Hugo von Hofmannsthal, which will have its premiere at the 5th of June 2013 in the Gethsemane church, Copenhagen.



The Summoning of Everyman tells the story of Everyman, a shopaholic rich-bitch, who, in her late 30s, is suddenly summoned to answer for her deeds; in her entourage we also find her young gold-digging, coke-snorting fuck-buddy, Sigfried and her BFF, whose arrogance is only to be overshadowed by her stupidity. 


When Death shows up at one of her parties, Everyman gets only a few hours to balance out her Karmic Account, or she will end up in hell. 



Not only is she about to die and go to hell, but also has to answer the question: 
“How do you clean up your shit in only a couple of hours?” – That’s a tough one!



Only to make things more interesting for Everyman, she has to deal with a psychopathic bible-basher - her beloved mother, Dorotha, a crazy, begging Gipsy-Polack hypocrite mutant, and even the cousins, Satan and Mammon appear to her on her last day on Earth. The play is filled with bizarre characters, which put our own human existence and ethics into perspective – in a church where the taboos are broken and the fun is free for all.

 

This is a plead. We need your help. We need your help to show Copenhagen that real artists do not let political schemes and internal powerplay ruin their work - it makes us only stronger.


Please share this - that's also helping alot. Your mom's friend could see this on Facebook and think: "Holy mother of Jesus, this is so important!" And boom - your moms friend is now a producer! Thanks to you!

 

What you will get for your money (Not to mention the fact that you keep our hopes, about coming professional actors, alive) See on the side, and at the bottom:

 

Danish

Komedien om Enhver

Gethsemanekirken i perioden 5-9 juni, 2013.

Kvinden Enhver var rig på aktier og fede tasker, og havde både venner, der drak hende under bordet, og en fræk toy-boy hun kunne lege med om aftenen. Da Enhver får påbud af Døden om, at hun skal på den rejse, hvorfra ingen vender tilbage, laver hun et desperat forsøg på at tage alt det hun ejer med sig, men finder hurtigt ud af at livets pølse er speget – ligesom alle hendes venner.

”Komedien om Enhver” er en klassisk komedie, bygget over middelalderens kirkelige Mysterie- og Moralitetsspil. Det er skrevet i 1911 af Hugo von Hofmannsthal, og handler om livets store moralske og eksistentielle spørgsmål; om dødsangsten og troen, om dyder og laster, om penge og venskab.

Stykket er sprængfyldt med bizarre karakterer: En stressramt Gud, Døden og hendes Baby, en sarkastisk Engel, en dødsangst Shopaholic, en snu Polak, en gold-digging Loverboy, Fætter Grådig, en feststemt Mammon, ja selv en forsmået Satan kommer på besøg i dette dramatiske festfyrværkeri, hvor alt er tilladt og intet er helligt.

Komedien bliver opført i Gethsemane-kirken i perioden 5 – 9. juni 2013, og er en produktion af de tidligere elever på FILM+Teaterskolen Holberg.

Eleverne mistede deres ledelse og to hoved-lærere i februar 2013, da skolens bestyrelse fyrede dem fra den ene dag til den anden. Dermed var skolens to grundpiller fjernet. Efterfølgende blev en ny leder ansat, der valgte at fritstille resten af lærer og senere lukkede skolen.

Røvrendt og svigtet står vi, uden kostumer, sminke, øvelokaler, regi, lys og lyd. Men integriteten har vi stadigvæk og viljen til at skabe. Derfor beder vi jer om hjælp til at finansiere dette projekt, som vi brænder så meget for, og som har været med til at definere os – både som kunstnere og som mennesker.

 

 

Engang var der en almægtig Gud.

Op på et kors han hængte sin søn,
Gav os nådesord og strenge bud.


Men nu, handler livet om Vuitton og kønsdele.


Ingen fattig jomfru sidder læng’re i løn

Så Gud gav os teatret til at ta’ pis på det hele!

At skabe og dele
– det er vores vision.

 

 

Hvad fu får / What you get! :

 


1€: 
A TREE WITH YOUR NAME ON IT - (The "I'm so proud of it, I put my..." effect)
We will plant a tree, outside our old school, and hang all of our supporters’ names on it. It will resemble our life and what we have to give up in order to fulfill our dreams. Your name will be on the tree of our life! 


25€:
A POSTER
A poster with our signature on it. Your name on the tree of life.

35€:
A POSTER COLLECTION AND A STRESS BALL
You get 8 different posters with our signature on them. Your name on the tree of life and a stress ball with a character print!

40€: 
DVD & POSTER
A DVD with “Behind the scenes”, a poster and your name on the tree of life.

80€:
DVD POSTER COLLECTION
A DVD with “Behind the scenes”, 8 different posters from the play and your name on the tree of life.

100€:
DVD & POSTER COLLECTION AND 2 STRESS BALLS
Probably the most relaxing perk on Indiegogo right now.

500€:
PRODUCER
You will be titled “Producer” in the brochure. And you will get your name on a crown on the tree of life! Now how about that?

1000€: (2 pledges possible)
THE CHARACTER “YOÜ” BECOMES ALIVE
If pledged by 26th of May, you will get your own character in the play – based on you. The photo of YOÜ will be hung on the tree of life.

 At the end of February 2013, the students at Theatre School Holberg, Copenhagen, suddenly lost all their teachers. The board of the school fired our artistic directors and hired a new school leader, who fired the rest of our teachers. He thought that was smart – we thought it was ridiculous, that in only a couple of days, we went from stopping our beloved Shakespeare rehearsals to returning to an arrogant and hostile atmosphere at the school. We didn’t sign up for that. We didn’t pay for that. And we protested. So they just closed our school, leaving us behind with nothing, and then opened it up again, with the same name. And they seem to think that they have no obligations towards us. (No worries though, we have pressed charges)
 But we couldn’t stay stuck in those people's political scheme and had to move on and make some theatre. And the decision was to put on the play “The Summoning of Everyman” by Hugo von Hofmannsthal, which will have its premiere at the 5th of June 2013 in the Gethsemane church, Copenhagen.
 The Summoning of Everyman tells the story of Everyman, a shopaholic rich-bitch, who, in her late 30s, is suddenly summoned to answer for her deeds; in her entourage we also find her young gold-digging, coke-snorting fuck-buddy, Sigfried and her BFF, whose arrogance is only to be overshadowed by her stupidity. 
 When Death shows up at one of her parties, Everyman gets only a few hours to balance out her Karmic Account, or she will end up in hell. 
 Not only is she about to die and go to hell, but also has to answer the question:  “How do you clean up your shit in only a couple of hours?” – That’s a tough one!
 Only to make things more interesting for Everyman, she has to deal with a psychopathic bible-basher - her beloved mother, Dorotha, a crazy, begging Gipsy-Polack hypocrite mutant, and even the cousins, Satan and Mammon appear to her on her last day on Earth. The play is filled with bizarre characters, which put our own human existence and ethics into perspective – in a church where the taboos are broken and the fun is free for all.
 
This is a plead. We need your help. We need your help to show Copenhagen that real artists do not let political schemes and internal powerplay ruin their work - it makes us only stronger.
 Please share this - that's also helping alot. Your mom's friend could see this on Facebook and think: "Holy mother of Jesus, this is so important!" And boom - your moms friend is now a producer! Thanks to you!
 
What you will get for your money (Not to mention the fact that you keep our hopes, about coming professional actors, alive) See on the side, and at the bottom:
 
Danish



Komedien om Enhver 
Gethsemanekirken i perioden 5-9 juni, 2013. 
Kvinden Enhver var rig på aktier og fede tasker, og havde både venner, der drak hende under bordet, og en fræk toy-boy hun kunne lege med om aftenen. Da Enhver får påbud af Døden om, at hun skal på den rejse, hvorfra ingen vender tilbage, laver hun et desperat forsøg på at tage alt det hun ejer med sig, men finder hurtigt ud af at livets pølse er speget – ligesom alle hendes venner. 
”Komedien om Enhver” er en klassisk komedie, bygget over middelalderens kirkelige Mysterie- og Moralitetsspil. Det er skrevet i 1911 af Hugo von Hofmannsthal, og handler om livets store moralske og eksistentielle spørgsmål; om dødsangsten og troen, om dyder og laster, om penge og venskab. 
Stykket er sprængfyldt med bizarre karakterer: En stressramt Gud, Døden og hendes Baby, en sarkastisk Engel, en dødsangst Shopaholic, en snu Polak, en gold-digging Loverboy, Fætter Grådig, en feststemt Mammon, ja selv en forsmået Satan kommer på besøg i dette dramatiske festfyrværkeri, hvor alt er tilladt og intet er helligt. 
Komedien bliver opført i Gethsemane-kirken i perioden 5 – 9. juni 2013, og er en produktion af de tidligere elever på FILM+Teaterskolen Holberg.
Eleverne mistede deres ledelse og to hoved-lærere i februar 2013, da skolens bestyrelse fyrede dem fra den ene dag til den anden. Dermed var skolens to grundpiller fjernet. Efterfølgende blev en ny leder ansat, der valgte at fritstille resten af lærer og senere lukkede skolen.
Røvrendt og svigtet står vi, uden kostumer, sminke, øvelokaler, regi, lys og lyd. Men integriteten har vi stadigvæk og viljen til at skabe. Derfor beder vi jer om hjælp til at finansiere dette projekt, som vi brænder så meget for, og som har været med til at definere os – både som kunstnere og som mennesker. 
 
 
Engang var der en almægtig Gud.Op på et kors han hængte sin søn,Gav os nådesord og strenge bud.
Men nu, handler livet om Vuitton og kønsdele.
Ingen fattig jomfru sidder læng’re i løn
Så Gud gav os teatret til at ta’ pis på det hele!
At skabe og dele – det er vores vision.
 



 
Hvad fu får / What you get! :
 
1€: A TREE WITH YOUR NAME ON IT - (The "I'm so proud of it, I put my..." effect) We will plant a tree, outside our old school, and hang all of our supporters’ names on it. It will resemble our life and what we have to give up in order to fulfill our dreams. Your name will be on the tree of our life! 
25€: A POSTER A poster with our signature on it. Your name on the tree of life.35€: A POSTER COLLECTION AND A STRESS BALL You get 8 different posters with our signature on them. Your name on the tree of life and a stress ball with a character print!40€:  DVD & POSTER A DVD with “Behind the scenes”, a poster and your name on the tree of life.80€: DVD POSTER COLLECTION A DVD with “Behind the scenes”, 8 different posters from the play and your name on the tree of life.100€: DVD & POSTER COLLECTION AND 2 STRESS BALLS Probably the most relaxing perk on Indiegogo right now.500€: PRODUCER You will be titled “Producer” in the brochure. And you will get your name on a crown on the tree of life! Now how about that?1000€: (2 pledges possible) THE CHARACTER “YOÜ” BECOMES ALIVE If pledged by 26th of May, you will get your own character in the play – based on you. The photo of YOÜ will be hung on the tree of life.

story:
BECOME A PATRON OF OPS FEST

Please support our efforts by making a monetary gift to WIL Festival. Our performers step into the shoes of 16th century professionals and walk miles in them all summer long, discovering how Original Practice succeeds in the 21st century.

If you’re ready to give, check out the sidebar to the right of your screen and find a level of giving that matches your means and your corresponding gift. If you want to learn more, read below!

HOW YOU CAN GIVE...

Our shows are always admission free. To pay our actors in this year's WIL Festival will cost approximately $2,500! We need your help to make that happen!

Help us raise $2,500 - a substantial portion of our operating budget, symbolic of mounting the WIL Festival!

Of course we don't expect all our supporters to be substantial contributors. When you join us in the park, we'll ask you to drop a small contribution into a post-show bucket (our version of passing the hat), and if you are able to give more than spare change or cash on hand, we gladly accept a check or credit card on site. THANK YOU to everyone who has given and continues to give. We simply cannot do it without you.

...AND WHAT YOU WILL GET

Patrons of Shakespeare's company were known to favor individual actors, sometimes directly supporting them with personal tips or gifts or voting with their wallets in other ways: expanding an actor's wardrobe, perhaps in turn helping him win larger, more impressive roles.

We've taken some inspiration from the older economic structure in designing your perks:

SPONSOR AN ACTOR and you have the option to have a creative exchange over a role, perhaps inspiring the kind of character, costume, or behaviors you'll see on stage.

BUSINESS OWNER? Shakespeare's plays are notoriously referential - his audience was used to hearing jabs at rival playwrights, shout outs to favorite taverns, or send ups of contemporary political figures.

FIND A LEVEL OF SUPPORT THAT WORKS FOR YOU! (See the full list of perks and levels of giving to the right.)

YOUR IMPACT

Many of our performers have begun to master the combination of text analysis, vocal and physical athleticism, and improvisation skills that cue script performance demands. Through a combination of training and rigorous experience, impossible to recreate without a viable company.

With the help of Ronni Lacroute, as well as The Swinford Family Foundation, we've been able to hire professional actors at competitive rates and find a home in the local theatre community.

We keep costs low so we can expand the reach of our season into more neighborhoods. Relative to the modern tradition of massive set construction and architectural verisimilitude, our universal set is lightweight, compact, and reusable. Our tents, costumes, weapons, and minimal properties are available on-location via our spectacular trailer, so we are able travel the Portland metro area and beyond!

We need you! This Indegogo campaign must earn $2,500. If you can help us meet our goal, we’ll be on track for next summer's festival, able to recruit and retain experienced actors, and staffing 12-hour production marathons. Come see for yourself why folks of all ages make our seasons an integral part of their summer!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

  • Attend a show!
  • Share This Campaign! (Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us promote our goal for next season.)

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT, TIME AND GENEROSITY.
